qas.question: What term refers to the legislature of the Isle of man?
In what year was lordship of the Isle of Man purchased?
What does the term the Revestment refer to?

answers.text: lordship of the Island was purchased by the British Crown in 1765

qas.question: How is royal assent currently granted in the Isle of Man?
Previous to the Order in Council method, how was royal assent passed previously within the Isle of Man?

answers.text: by letter from the Secretary of State to the governor

qas.question: What is the legislature of the Isle of Women?
The lordship of the Isle of Man was purchased by America in what year?
After 1665, royal assent was signified how?
Who signified the letter of royal assent in America after 1765?

context: Special procedures apply to legislation passed by <a0_0><b5_0>Tynwald<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the legislature of the Isle of Man. Before the <a2_0>lordship of the Island was purchased by the British Crown in <a1_0><b6_0>1765<b6_0/><a2_0/><a1_0/> (the Revestment), the assent of the Lord of Mann to a bill was signified by letter to the governor. After 1765, royal assent was at first signified <a4_0>by <b7_0>letter<b7_0/> from <b8_0>the Secretary of State<b8_0/> to the governor<a4_0/>; but, during the British Regency, the practice began of granting royal assent by <a3_0>Order in Council<a3_0/>, which continues to this day, though limited to exceptional cases since 1981.
